Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above two added white bands; exterior: possibly a bull (part of shoulder and neck remaining; with red blob on shoulder) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the shoulder decoration on Chian bulls, see Lemos 1991, p. 35, fig. 9.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0585) (phase 2)
